title: MEC6018 Lighting Technology for Building Services | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module provides a fundamental understanding of lighting principles in the context of performance-based building design and diagnostics.

MEC6018 Lighting Technology for Building Services
MEC6018 Lighting Technology for Building Services
This module provides a fundamental understanding of lighting principles in the context of performance-based building design and diagnostics.

Effective from AY2025/26 Trimester 2 (January 2026), the Postgraduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering will be transiting to Graduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering. For more details, please refer to the full notice
In this module, learners will understand the fundamental lighting principals in the context of performance based building design and diagnostics.

Learners will acquire detail knowledge on relevant aspects of lighting physics that affect the physiological and psychological experience of buildings, performance metrics, design and benchmarking methodologies, and contemporary simulation tools. The first-hand case studies in lighting design, technologies, and project management will also be delivered by the experienced experts in the lighting industry. Learners will apply the knowledge acquired to their lighting design project assignment. Student's progress shall be assessed through Continuous Assessment, final design project presentation, final report and design poster, and final examination.
Basic BIM MEP knowledge is required
Candidate should possess a post-bachelor degree qualification, in the built environment or engineering industry
Candidate must have at least one year of relevant work experience in the built environment or engineering industry
Describe lighting basics in built environment
Understand the basic interaction between daylighting and electric lighting
Describe lighting monitoring and control technologies and methods
Synthesise different parameters affecting lighting design and its performance
Conduct simulation-based lighting analysis in view of climate, occupants, energy, spatial, and temporal diversity
Evaluate different lighting design strategies in terms of whole building design performance together with impacts on built environment
Apply the knowledge to generate lighting design based on user needs, requirements, technology and project assessment
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. CHIEN Szu-Cheng is a building scientist and educator working in the fields of lighting for built environment and urban farming. He joined the Cluster of Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) in 2017 as Assistant Professor and was later named Associate Professor in 2022. Before joining SIT, he was a visiting scholar in UC Berkeley in 2016.  He had worked with Nanyang Technological University and NRF CREATE SinBerBEST Program (Singapore) as a research fellow from 2011 to 2016. Previously in Austria, he was a senior researcher in TU Vienna and visiting researcher in Austria Institute of Technology from 2009 to 2011. He has led and participated in a variety of research and design activities related to the topics of lighting, visual comfort, urban farming, sustainable/ intelligent buildings in Austria (FWF), Singapore (MOE, SFA, LTA, NRF, BCA), USA. He works closely with Singapore’s government agencies and various industry collaborators on exploring the best practices of visual performance, human-centric and horticulture lighting in tropical built environment. His research team has received NMRC Clinician Innovator Development Award (CIDA) in Singapore in 2021. He is the members of Illuminating Engineering Society (IES) Committees, namely i) Daylighting and ii) Aged and Partially Sighted Lighting.He is a certified BIM professional and Green Mark Manager in Singapore. His professional affiliations include membership in several international associations, including IES, IBPSA, WSSET, and APEC Lighting Working Group. He obtained his PhD in Architecture from TU Vienna, MFA (Arch) from TNNUA, and BSc (Arch) from NCKU in Taiwan respectively.
Director, Lux Consultancy Singapore Pte. Ltd.
Director, Lux Consultancy Singapore Pte. Ltd.

Mr. Chris Teo started his career path from sales, then to Project Management, and now a Lighting Consultant. Driven by his passion to provide innovative & cost-efficient solutions, Lux Consultancy Pte. Ltd. was created in October 2012 and now known as Lux Consultancy Singapore Pte. Ltd. To date, he has worked with Architects like A-Dlab, RT&Q, WOW, SCDA, Woha, ECOid etc. As for Interior Designers, he has worked with Museum IDs’, ID Departments, Jane Yeo Designs etc. Through the years of having hands-on experiences, he has excelled & perfected his capabilities of lighting design to better serve his clients. Through self-taught, he succeeded in presenting his ideas through Dialux to his clients, inclusive of both architects & designers. He is also a certified Dialux trainer since August 2013 and joined the Dial trainers network from Aug 2013 to 2019.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Postgraduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$3,606.88
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

The Postgraduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering is designed to address industry needs to reskill, deepen skills, upskill, and increase knowledge of industry professionals in building services engineering.
